channel.title: Posts on YenTing Chen
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on YenTing Chen

item.title: Rust Lang at a Glance
item.description: Just a quick glance at Rust-lang, haven’t really done things with it. But I’m interested in its memory management system, so called “ownership”, and no “null” design. Rust, borned in 2006, was firstly a personal project but then sponsored by Mozilla since 2009.

item.title: You but Not Only You
item.description: RailsConf 2019, as a technical conference, there is a bunch of presentations about the fundamentals, deep inside the Rails framework, leveling up the skills. Rather than deep diving into those talks I attended, I would like to share more about DHH and other speakers’ thoughts about the Rails community, the connections within it and the bonds with the world.

item.title: Httplog, the Useful Tool for Rubyist to Debug Http Request
item.description: Our application introduced “Sharing to Twitter” feature and we did our own integration with Twitter API. We maintained the integration by ourselves because we did not want to introduce too many dependencies.

item.title: As a Porter Among Tables in Postgresql
item.description: Imagine we have two tables, creations and creation_metadata. id of creations table is foreign key of creation_metadata table. They should be one-to-one relation but actually, records in creations table might not have a corresponding row in creation_metadata table.

item.title: Ruby Http Request
item.description: During trial on sending GET request to AppFigures’ RESTful API, I started with net/http and add my client key to request hash. When firing the request, I have some more request params to use.
